name: Art for the Deads
description:
"You are on death row. Instead of a last meal, you're offered one last moment with the artwork of your choice."

What is art to you? How would you face death, despair, ineluctibility? What does your senses reveal or hide about our world? Is there a way for you to survive? Should you even try?

This work was created to validate a course and is my first game ever. It's not much: all I hope is that it provides an enjoyable moment of heartfelt reflexion. Some parts may touch your heart, other may seem completely absurd. It's part of the experience: art is a state of mind and no two people will feel the same thing at the same time.

This game contains nine different endings. Each path takes only a few minutes to be completed. Overall, expect less than 20 minutes of gameplay,.

For any inquiry, remark, advice, please seek @maurel_perrine on Twitter.

TW: Death mention, body horror
